abstract: UBS awarded its new investment bank chief, Andrea Orcel, almost 25 million Swiss francs in deferred cash and shares to compensate him for pay he forfeited upon leaving Bank of America Merrill Lynch. The amount dwarfs the 8.87 million francs UBS paid its chief executive, Sergio P. Ermotti, in 2012.
snippet: UBS awarded its new investment bank chief, Andrea Orcel, almost 25 million Swiss francs in deferred cash and shares to compensate him for pay he forfeited upon leaving Bank of America Merrill Lynch. The amount dwarfs the 8.87 million francs UBS pa...
lead_paragraph: LONDON — UBS said on Thursday that it had awarded its new investment bank chief, Andrea Orcel, 24.9 million Swiss francs, or $26 million, in deferred cash and shares, to compensate him for pay he forfeited when he left Bank of America Merrill Lynch.

headline.main: UBS Pays Investment Bank Chief $26 Million

abstract: As long as there is always one bank out there willing to bid high, existing pay structures will be hard to change, the author writes.
snippet: As long as there is always one bank out there willing to bid high, existing pay structures will be hard to change, the author writes.
lead_paragraph: Andrea Orcel’s signing-on package shows the scale of the pay pickle facing banks.

abstract: The Federal Reserve said Goldman and JPMorgan would need to resubmit their proposals to pay out billions of dollars to shareholders, citing weaknesses in their capital plans.
snippet: The Federal Reserve said Goldman and JPMorgan would need to resubmit their proposals to pay out billions of dollars to shareholders, citing weaknesses in their capital plans.
lead_paragraph: Goldman Sachs and JPMorgan Chase, the Wall Street giants that emerged from the financial crisis in a position of strength, are now facing questions about their ability to withstand future market shocks.

headline.main: Fed Rebukes Goldman Sachs and JPMorgan Chase Over Capital Plans
headline.print_headline: Fed Faults 2 Big Banks Over Plans For Capital
